question: How likely would you be to use this or a similar app to try to conceive a child?

What indicators do you think this app uses to predict period days, ovulation, fertile window?
The app store page you analyzed mentioned Kaya offer "personalized fertility recommendations." In your opinion, what does it mean?
If you learn that the app uses only your period dates to predict your fertile window, how likely would you be to track:[Ovulation predictor kit's results?]

If you learn that the app uses only your period dates to predict your fertile window, how likely would you be to track:[Cervical Mucus]
If you learn that the app uses only your period dates to predict your fertile window, how likely would you be to track:[Symptoms]
If you learn that the app uses only your period dates to predict your fertile window, how likely would you be to track:[Mood]
Please let us know what aspects you considered to make these choices

If you learn that the app uses all the listed indicators (i.e., temperature, cervical mucus, ovulation predictor kit's results, symptoms, and mood) to predict your fertile window, how likely would you be to track all of them?
Why?
If collecting temperature and mood will increase the accuracy of predictions from 90% to 95%, how likely would you be to track them everyday?
Why?
What do you think about the calendar visualization?
If you are trying to avoid conception, and your fertile window starts on the 22nd (as in the image), how likely would you be to have intercourse without another form of contraception on the 21th?
Why?
